comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Auriol Lee (1880-1941), English-born stage actress, also worked in a few films: www.imdb.com/name/nm0496843/

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: There are two dates written on the negative: 1/24/13 and 1/6/31. In January 1931, she was in the news because she inherited the estate of a British Air Vice-Marshal killed in an air-crash. See select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F40715FE355C157A... on NYT page 9, January 1, 1931 [not freely available]

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The two photos of Auriol Lee, captioned Act 1 and Act 3 (see www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3085244068/ ) , seem likely to be from "Milestones," which opened in New York in September 1912 and ran until March 1913, according to www.ibdb.com/production.php?id=7497 "MILESTONES' PLAY OF THREE GENERATIONS; Both Charm and Poignant Pathos to Unusual Work by Arnold Bennett and Edward Knoblauch." NYT, September 18, 1912, Wednesday query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9404E1D81630E233A... Auriol Lee played Gertrude. Act 1 is in 1860 and Act 3 in 1912.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks for the information. We'll add it to the source catalog.

comment.author: 35535881@N08
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/23103743@N05] Hi I have just found out about Auriol Lee, after finally getting her father"s name decipered on a print out I had.
She is the daughter of my G.G. Aunt, so very removed but over the last 5 years we knew so little about our family on my dad's side I started searching.  
I understand her father is related to General Robert Edward Lee.   His name was Robert James Lee,  I thought originally by the dates he was the general's son but not so.
If you might have any info on this to share it would be appreciated.  My big drive with family history too is that we have hardly any images of our ancestors, to this end it has been great finding about Auriol Lee.   What is your interest in her if its okay to ask ??
Claire
